body.p: This department was created and Nathan Bedford Forrest assumed command on January 26, 1864. This command consisted of all cavalry units in parts of West Tennessee and North Mississippi, “as far south as the southern boundaries of the counties of Monroe, Calhoun, Chickasaw, Yalobusha, Tallahatchie, and that part of Sunflower and Bolivar lying north of a line drawn from the southwest corner of Tallahatchie County to the town of Prentiss, on the Mississippi River.” This department surrendered on May 9, 1865. Commander(s): Nathan Bedford Forrest.
